title: LovelaceAcademy translation Spanish
description:
应该用能带来多种语言内容的解决方案来降低语言障碍。
我们希望翻译我们的视频内容

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement being lowering the language barrier but having contents related to Cardano ecosystem translated into other languages.
In the proposal the proposer want to translate their youtube content into Portuguese to reach more Portuguese speaking audience but this challenge being "Grow Latin America, Grow Cardano"  and In Latin America Spanish is the most spoken language and second would be Portuguese. If the content was translated into both Spanish and Portuguese. 
It would have effectively addressed the challenge and would have helped more people in Latin America to understand more about the Cardano Ecosystem but the proposer is translating the content only into Portuguese so, it somewhat addresses the challenge
f6_assessments.q1:
In the proposal the proposer have mentioned themselves has a content creator and educator which should be enough experience to carry out the proposal. In the plan they have mentioned about translating 50 episodes (25 episodes about programming languages and 25 episodes about general subjects)
of content into Portuguese but upon visiting their Lovelace Academy Channel I found that they doesn't have 50 episodes of the content which they have mentioned in the proposal.
and doesn't have any programming languages related Content.
As information provided in the proposal do not match It's very unlikely this proposal will be implemented successfully
f6_assessments.q2:
As their Lovelace Academy Channel doesn't have 50 videos which was mentioned in the proposal and the proposer hasn't provided any detailed timeline and a detailed budget allocation. 
The information provided wouldn't be sufficient to track and audit the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal in theory meets the objectives of the challenge, but in practice, I encountered a big problem. They say they will translate 50 videos that are on the youtube channel, however, when I went to the provided link and went to the videos part (https://www.youtube.com/c/LovelaceAcademy/videos), I saw that the channel only had 9 videos posted. I accessed the platform on 12/11/21, during the access period, and if there were still videos to be posted, it is time for the channel to be updated so that we can evaluate the proposal. As it is, unfortunately, there is no way to achieve the promised goals. If the channel really had that number of videos and they were translated into Portuguese and Spanish (in the proposal, they only mention Portuguese, but in the part of the success metrics they talk about the number of new subscribers coming from Spanish-speaking countries... therefore it is confused), yes, the proposal would suit very well what we are looking for in the challenge; it would be taking to Latin America various contents of the Cardano ecosystem, in order to educate people and make them likely participants in the community, also benefiting our blockchain. However, due to the dissonance in what is said and what happens, this objective would be little contemplated.
f6_assessments.q1: We have very little detail about the trio. We know their names, we know that Maria Carmo 369 has 3 channels related to Cardano (which ones?), and we don't know anything about the other two members of the team. We would need more information, such as: your roles in the project, a little history of what you have been working on so far, what is your relationship with the Cardano ecosystem, and so on. Without such information, unfortunately, no confidence in the team's ability to successfully carry out the project is conveyed. There is also no well-defined script, we are only told that they intend to translate the content of the videos into Portuguese. It is doubtful whether the same would be done for Spanish. We don't know how long these translations will be done, how often translated videos would be posted, who would translate into which language, how the target audience would be reached (how would they know about such translations?). It would be essential that they elaborate phases to be followed in a linear way and related to the passage of time. Only then could we have a good view of the process. And finally, regarding the financing, all the money is based on the work of translating. They estimate 5 hours of translation per video at a price of $30 an hour; I find this expensive, not knowing exactly who would be translating, if that person has complete command of both languages. And there's also the fact that you'd have to sync the subtitles as well as create them. Would that part already be included in the $150 per video? I believe that, unfortunately, this whole topic has flaws, and could be reformulated for a better understanding of the items analyzed here.
f6_assessments.q2: The team only provides us with two KPIs, which would be the number of registrations from users coming from Spanish-speaking countries and the number of registrations of Portuguese speakers in the IOG programming courses. I believe they are good ways to measure the project's success, because once Portuguese speakers watch the videos and learn about Cardano, they would be interested in learning our blockchain's programming language; the other data is more direct, speaking directly of subscribers to the channel. However, I felt that this information is insufficient to measure the project's success. Other data that could be analyzed: number of subscribers from Portuguese-speaking countries / amount of interaction (likes and comments) in the channel's videos / length of stay in the videos, etc. It would also be important to monitor the process itself: are the translations being delivered as promised? I think auditability could happen here in two ways, either the trio gathering the data cited in reports and presenting it to the community or Portuguese/Spanish speakers who were already part of the community monitoring the quality and frequency of the subtitles. I think we have a principle of auditability here, but it needs to be really deepened.

f6_assessments.q0:
The solution given is very obvious but not enough to completely solve the problem of the project.
  Break the language barrier by translating 50 episodes from Lovelace Academy Channel into Portuguese. It is a little difficult to understand this proposition. The proponent should provide more information on how it fits into the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
In my opinion, this proposal is not viable because the proponent does not present detailed information about the team members who will work on the project. Maybe I'm mistaken, but I notice you've written a lot of proposals with similar content, but most of them don't have a complete plan. I recommend finding experienced collaborators to help you complete the proposals well
Study group is an important aspect to evaluate feasibility. All I know about this team are the names. I think the team is important for the successful implementation of proposals, so when you reveal the identity and experience of the team, it will be easier for us to trust the feasibility of the proposals.
f6_assessments.q2:
The stated budget is reasonable enough and explains how to use the budget clearly.
A section on measuring success was provided, but there was a lack of alignment of challenge metrics and KPIs. Your proposal title speaks Portuguese but in the description you only mention Spanish. So will you put subtitles in Portuguese or Spanish or both?
The proposal does not include information about the roadmap, milestones, or timescales for achieving the desired results. There is no roadmap, no timeline as well as achievable goals of the proposal, which makes it difficult for the audit work.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal focuses on translating the 50 episodes from Lovelace Academy Channel into Spanish [25 about programming languages and 25 about general subjects]. The solution is short and clearly described [with a logical plan, specific metrics for measuring the success of video content], with a clear impact on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole, and Latin community development in particular. Based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's impact, and would give it a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q1: The team's profile is not fully described [only 1/3 member - Maria Carmo 369 - briefly described as "educator and content creator across 3 channels in the community all Cardano related"], and without any proof/external link for verification. However, the youtube channel provides proof of the feasibility of this team, with Cardano-related video content, and translating these existing videos is not a problem for this Latin team, I suppose. KPIs are very suitable, specific, and measurable. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly agree with this proposal's feasibility, and would give it a score of 5.
f6_assessments.q2: The provided information is enough for understanding. My only advice is: these 02 other members of the team [Keith and Shweta] should be provided for better understanding. Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's auditability, and would give it a score of 4.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal effectively addresses the challenge by dealing with the language barrier to quality content access within latin america, where english has a limited spread. The main focus of the team seems to be translation of already existing content produced by this team for now which is a very cost effective way to expand the reach of already available content, it would be great to see it evolve to original content in spanish. The proposal mentions in the title translation to spanish but in the text only portuguese is mentioned.
f6_assessments.q1:
- The team has a succesful history of funded proposals (Lovelace Academy) and therefore is in a good position to expand into Spanish and Portuguese.
- It would help to see a detailed timeline with specific milestones and dates for the plan implementation. 
- The budget seems to be reasonable for successful implementation.
- Generic KPIs are proposed to measure success, In future iterations of this initiative it would be great to see specific values as goals.
f6_assessments.q2: The implementation of this proposal is easy to verify as it should be public content on a youtube channel, but the fact of not having a specific timeline or goals for the KPIs proposed makes it difficult to meassure effective delivery.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal recognizes correctly that language barrier can be a problem for mass adoption. I think the problem statement can be polished to highlight how exactly the lack of English comprehension can be a barrier. I am not sure of the impact of the proposal however. The Youtube channel only has 6 videos as opposed to the 50 videos mentioned in the proposal. There's also no programming language videos posted yet. I am impressed by the interviewer's ability and the guests, but there is not enough submitted videos to determine that this will bring a positive impact on Cardano. I am also interested to know if this would scale well. Would the channel be conducted completely in Spanish and Portugese in the future?
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal is lacking in information on the team. There is a Twitter profile(@LovelaceAcademy), a website, and a Telegram channel on the Youtube channel. This should be included in the proposal. Maria Carmo's Twitter account shared this YouTube video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uZ6bSXH8DX8&t=2s  . It seems to be an educational video done in Portugese, with Maria's picture in the header image. Is this what's going to be translated into Spanish? The proposal should include the necessary links to get a full picture.
f6_assessments.q2: The time horizon seems to be 6 weeks, if the 250 hours required are divided into 40 hour workweeks. The KPI is a bit out of the proposer's hands: new youtube subscribers would be a definite measure of success, but not promised just because it is now translated into Spanish. Would the funding be better used if it went into marketing?
